publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1607 Fiona Hyslop: Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh—That the Parliament notes with concern the continuing delay in providing a reception centre and hostel provision in Edinburgh under the Rough Sleepers Initiative and the findings of the report Rough Sleeping In Edinburgh – The Hard Evidence by the Edinburgh Streetwork Project, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to directly intervene to ensure that the need for accommodation and support services for homeless people in the city is met sooner rather than later, as the delay in provision is undermining any national effort to prevent rough sleeping. Supported by: Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*
S1M-1607 Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh (lodged on 30 January 2001) Michael Matheson*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Andrew Welsh*
S1M-1607 Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh (lodged on 30 January 2001) Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1607 Fiona Hyslop: Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh—That the Parliament notes with concern the continuing delay in providing a reception centre and hostel provision in Edinburgh under the Rough Sleepers Initiative and the findings of the report Rough Sleeping In Edinburgh – The Hard Evidence by the Edinburgh Streetwork Project, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to directly intervene to ensure that the need for accommodation and support services for homeless people in the city is met sooner rather than later, as the delay in provision is undermining any national effort to prevent rough sleeping. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Robin Harper, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Ms Sandra White, Mr Andrew Welsh, Alex Neil, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-1607 Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh (lodged on 30 January 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Shona Robison*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1607 Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh (lodged on 30 January 2001) Irene McGugan*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*, Michael Russell*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1607 Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh (lodged on 30 January 2001) Brian Adam*

S1M-1607 Fiona Hyslop: Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh—That the Parliament notes with concern the continuing delay in providing a reception centre and hostel provision in Edinburgh under the Rough Sleepers Initiative and the findings of the report Rough Sleeping In Edinburgh – The Hard Evidence by the Edinburgh Streetwork Project, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to directly intervene to ensure that the need for accommodation and support services for homeless people in the city is met sooner rather than later, as the delay in provision is undermining any national effort to prevent rough sleeping. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Robin Harper, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Ms Sandra White, Mr Andrew Welsh, Alex Neil, Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Andrew Wilson, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Brian Adam
S1M-1607 Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh (lodged on 30 January 2001) Fiona McLeod*

S1M-1607 Fiona Hyslop: Rough Sleeping in Edinburgh—That the Parliament notes with concern the continuing delay in providing a reception centre and hostel provision in Edinburgh under the Rough Sleepers Initiative and the findings of the report Rough Sleeping In Edinburgh – The Hard Evidence by the Edinburgh Streetwork Project, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to directly intervene to ensure that the need for accommodation and support services for homeless people in the city is met sooner rather than later, as the delay in provision is undermining any national effort to prevent rough sleeping. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Robin Harper, Michael Matheson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Ms Sandra White, Mr Andrew Welsh, Alex Neil, Tommy Sheridan, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Andrew Wilson, Irene McGugan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Brian Adam, Fiona McLeod, Roseanna Cunningham*
